Generation VII.Sun: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis's vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
Generation VII.Moon: It fires beams from its sickle-shaped petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: For self-protection, it pretends to be a bug Pokémon. Both of its arms bear keen-edged petals.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: As it slashes into its enemies, it looks like it's dancing. Its elegant appearance has led some to call it the most glamorous Grass Pokémon.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon resembles a beautiful flower. A properly raised Lurantis will have gorgeous, brilliant colors.
Generation VIII.Shield: The petals on this Pokémon's arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.

Generation IX.Scarlet: By masquerading as a bug Pokémon, it lowers the guard of actual bug Pokémon lured in by a scent of sweet flowers. Its sickles bring them down.
Generation IX.Violet: A lot of time and effort is required to maintain the vivid colors of its petals. This Pokémon puts its Trainer's attentiveness to the test.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Received from Samson Oak at Heahea Beach * ( Totem -sized)

Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Challenge Beach , Forest of Focus ( Wanderer ) Max Lair ( Dynamax Adventure )

Generation IX.Scarlet: North Province: Area One , Area Two , Area Three , Casseroya Lake , Socarrat Trail Tera Raid Battles ( 4★ )
Generation IX.Violet: North Province: Area One , Area Two , Area Three , Casseroya Lake , Socarrat Trail Tera Raid Battles ( 4★ )
